arm_group.description: Participants will log into a personalized website and engage in computerized tasks online.
Participants will log into a personalized website and engage in computerized tasks online.

brief_summary.textblock:
The present study will explore the effectiveness of a computer based neurobehavioral
      intervention in alleviating symptoms and improving emotion regulation in veteran's with
      PTSD. It will increase understanding of psychopathology at a neural-circuit level and aid
      development of new non-pharmacological treatment for PTSD. The study is managed by the Etkin
      Lab at Stanford University in California, but participants from the entire US are welcome to
      participate as the study is delivered online.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of a Novel Neuroplasticity-based Neurobehavioral Intervention for PTSD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  current PTSD

          -  internet access

          -  veteran of the US military

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  lifetime psychotic disorder,

          -  past-year substance dependence

intervention.description: Targeted, computerized interventions completed from the participants' own home on a computer.

facility.name: Stanford University, Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences

clinical_study.official_title: Use of a Novel Neuroplasticity-based Neurobehavioral Intervention for PTSD - A Nationwide, Online Study

primary_outcome.measure: Emotional conflict adaptation - EEG imaging and behavioral

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: PTSD- clinician assessed and self-report symptoms

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
